sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>tree</radical> in <radical>spring</radical> that's nice and <radical>dry</radical> will make a good <kanji>pole</kanji> or <kanji>rod</kanji>. Break it out of the ground and it's just flexible enough for tons of applications.
meaningInfo: Use this pole to hang your towels or curtains. Ooh, use it to pole vault!
readingMnemonic: After much deliberation, you decide to use this <kanji>pole</kanji> to go <reading>bow</reading>ling (<ja>ぼう</ja>). You line up a few more poles for the pins, and roll a rock toward them.
readingInfo: You decide to name this super hard, pole bowling tree-pole-pin bowling. Even harder than candlepin. The thinnest, most extreme pole bowling of all time!
